column1: Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) is a fast-growing type of lung cancer.
There are two types of SCLC: - Small cell carcinoma (oat cell cancer) - Combined small cell carcinoma Most SCLCs are of the oat cell type.
Small cell lung cancer is slightly more common in men than women.
SCLC is very rare in people who have never smoked.
SCLC is the most aggressive form of lung cancer.

Symptoms of SCLC include: - Bloody sputum (phlegm) - Chest pain - Cough - Loss of appetite - Shortness of breath - Weight loss - Wheezing Other symptoms that may occur with this disease, especially in the late stages, include: - Facial swelling - Fever - Hoarseness or changing voice - Swallowing difficulty - Weakness
